706263f-a.folder: Pierrepont Street & Henry Street, Brooklyn, NY

706262f-a.text:
Pierrepont Street, south side, west from Henry Street, showing from left to right from the second house, the home of the Rev. Richard Salter Storrs D.D. and the home of one Allen subsequently occupied by a Prof. West.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
706262f-a.folder: Pierrepont Street & Henry Street, Brooklyn, NY

706264f-b.text:
(1)
Pierrepont Street, north side, east from No. 95, at Henry towards Fulton Streets, showing among other buildings, the Reformed Church-on-the-Heights, at
No. 103, and the Unitarian Church of the Saviour, at No. 113.
June 11, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing a close up of the "Church on the Heights" (Reformed). The Congregation of this church organiszed in 1837 and erected their first place of worship on Henry Street as the "Central Church" (Dutch Reformed) in 1839. They disbanded in 1841 and the remainder of the Congregation formed the above named church shortly thereafter and laid the corner
stone at the present location in 1849.
1922.
Mugee  Armbruster Collection.  MAe BE REPRDUCED.
706264f-b.folder: Pierrepont Street & Henry Street, Brooklyn, NY

706261f-a.text:
Pierrepont Street, north side, west from Henry Street. (These homes
were demolished in August 1923).
1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Cellection.
706261f-a.folder: Pierrepont Street & Henry Street, Brooklyn, NY

706266f-a.text:
Pierrepont Street, north side, from Henry to Fulton Streets. In the foreground, is the Reformed Church on the Heights, beyond the Church of the
Saviour. (First Unitarian).
1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
706266f-a.folder: Pierrepont Street & Henry Street, Brooklyn, NY

704833f-b.text:
Henry Street, west side, north from a point midway between Love Lane and Clark Street, viewing toward the latter. In the foregroud is the First Presbyterian Church, erected in 1846, and about two hundred feet away is the First Methodist Episcopal Church, at the S.W. corner of Clark Street. At the N.W. corner
is the Hotel St. George (views 2,3).
1923
View 1: Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
Views 2,3: P. L. Sperr  View 2: March 1, 1929
NO REPRODUCTIONS  View 3: April 4, 1932
704833f-b.folder: Henry Street & Love Lane, Brooklyn, NY

704832f-b.text:
(1)
Henry Street, east side, north of Love Lane, showing three frame homes
Nos. 139-143.
About 1931.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, another view.
April 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

706265f-b.text:
95-111 Pierrepont Street, north side, west from Henry Street to Monroe Place. No. 111, the home of Dr. A. De Yoanna, is in the foreground, at the corner of Monroe Place.
August 10, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, except that only the house in foreground of view No. 1 is shown.
August 10, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
